title: Repeat Download of messages + only Headers
content:
Due to a large inbox file size and number of messages, I created subfolders on the AOL webmail. All have (with some tweaking) transferred into TB. However, in nearly all cases, all the subfolders only have headers despite having "subscribed" and "download/sync" under the offline option. Also, each time I open TB, it starts all the downloads from scratch...1 of 39K for example. See attached photo.

IMAP is set up as "export.imap.aol.com"...per last support advice...before it was just "imap.aol.com". Is there a chance this may be the issue due to how it communicates with the server?

If not, any idea why it always restarts the download of messages...and, why I go offline and only the headers in the subfolders can be viewed... Trying to open an email gets a message error trying to connect with server.
creator: younghowie

creator: gest.eu

title: Restoring .thunderbird correctly on a new Linux PC
content:
My backup is a simple copy of the .thunderbird folder.

From documentation and other users I have been told this restore procedure is correct:

1) On the new machine you open Thunderbird for the first time without making an account. That will force Thunderbird to create .thunderbird

2) You overwrite the created .thunderbird with your backup.

That is it. Thunderbird is restored.

There is hopefully just a 'small' thing missing about the versions.

I believe it is best if the Thunderbird version I restore to is the same or a newer version than the one the backup comes from. However a version that new can be hard to find in a main repo and sometimes it seems to go well in spite of the backup is coming from a newer version.

So my question is when it will go well and when not.?

Do we have a list somewhere so we can see how much older versions we can restore to from what and still be completely sure that it will do no damage to the mail database.? Will Thunderbird come up with a warning or reject the database if it is too new to be handled 100% safely.? Or how can I know for sure.?

I am trying to make a strict and bulletproof procedure so if you see something else missing or wrong please give me a hint.

Thank you. :-)
creator: Jakob77

title: Can’t save Identities, TB hangs
content:
Thunderbird 108.2.0/Linux Mint 20.3 MATE 1.26.0, Una base: Ubuntu 20.04 focal, Kernel: 5.15.0-60-generic x86_64

No identities can be saved. The program hangs itself in the process, apparently. A process is constantly running and Thunderbird is no longer operable. If I create a new account, I can add identities for it without problems. But only until I redirect the inbox of this account to the global inbox. After that, I can't save any identities to the new account either. Resetting to the account's own inbox does not fix the behavior.

title: Bir e-postayı açmakla virüs bulaşır mı?
content:
Merhaba,

Thunderbid'de bir e-postayı açmakla virüs bulaşır mı? Bu durum tehlikeli midir? Ne yapmalıyım?

Olay: Bugün bir e-posta aldım. İngilizceydi. Ne ile ilgili olduğunu anlamak için çeviriye yapıştırayım diye metnin bir kısmını kopyaladım. Sonra oltalama olduğuna karar verdim.

E-posta; bağlantı (yani link) ya da bir ek içeriyor muydu, bilmiyorum.

Yalnızca e-postayı açtım (birkaç kez açıp kapadım) ve metninden bir kısmını kopyaladım.

Notlar:

  • Uzak içerik ayarları ile ilgili bir değişiklik yapmış değilim.
  • E-posta; Firefox Relay'daki geçici e-posta adresime gönderilmiş.
  • Linux kullanıyorum. Antivirüs kullanmıyorum.

title: Recupero configurazione account Fastweb - problemi dopo cambio versione thunderbird.
content:
Salve! Sono un non vedente (che, quindi, non fa' uso di mouse, ma si muove con gli elementi forniti dalla tastiera). Io avevo installato (per una lunga prova) la versione beta di thunderbird. Io ho poi deciso di continuare con l'ultima versione definitiva di thunderbird. Quando ho cercato di recuperare i miei account, quindi dopo aver installato la versione definitiva _SOPRA la versione beta, per 3 miei account __non _ho _avuto _problemi, poiché,

- selezionato aggiungi account, - inserito nome,/cognome, email password 

  dato invio su continua,   il software ha recuperato tutti i miei dati: dati account, mails, ecc.

ma ... ecco il problema:

quando, seguendo sempre i precedenti passaggi, ho cercato di recuperare il mio account 

                   fastweb,

qui sono incominciati a sorgere problemi. 

  Prima di evidenziarli, ripeto ho seguito i medesimi passi degli altri

account, e, ovvio, importantissimo, i dati inseriti richiesti, sono perfetti tanto che, dal sito, l'accesso avviene regolarmente. 

  Ecco gli errori con le prove fatte:

- inseriti i dati richiesti, ho dato invio su continua, - ricevo in risposta:

riferimenti account recuperati.

- dò quindi invio su fatto e la risposta è:

- impossibile l'autenticazione sul server. 

  configurazione, nome utente o password potrebbero essere errati.

Se occorre, mi ripeto, con i medesimi dati, l'accesso dal sito riesce _TRANQUILLAMENTE.

Ho quindi provato a eseguire la configurazione utilizzando la modalità manuale:

- compilato tutti i campi regolarmente (con dati verificati, quindi validi) e la risposta è stata:

"ricerca configurazione verifica sul server. thunderbird non è riuscito a trovare le impostazioni per il tuo account. 

  Ecco, quindi, perché chiedo il vostro aiuto:

come dovrei proseguire in alternativa, per configurare il mio account, recuperando dati e mails? 

  Ringrazio anticipatamente chi potrà rispondermi.

Eventualmente scrivetemi a:

--RIMOSSO--@gmail.com. Grazie

~ Rimosso indirizzo email

title: Downloading files/images from email - How to default to the last folder used?
content:
Here is my scenario: I frequently email myself pictures from my iPhone that I want to store on my PC. I will attach X number of pictures in an email on my phone and send them to myself. I then access that email from Thunderbird. I right-click the image and select "Save Image As..." and pick the folder on my hard drive, create a filename for the image, and save the image (typically a JPG image).

For example, let's say I have an email with 3 JPG files. I will right click the first one, choose "Save Image As.." and navigate to C:\Temp and save the file with a file name of my choosing. I go back the Thunderbird and right click on the second image and select "Save Image As..". Instead of it defaulting to C:\Temp, it takes be back to Desktop as my save-to location and not C:\Temp. When I have a message with 5 or more files, this gets to be somewhat cumbersome and time consuming, especially when I am navigating to my Data hard drive and selecting a folder 3-4 levels down.

In Thunderbird, in Tools > Settings, I see the settings for "Files and Attachments". All of them, except PDF, are set to "Always Ask". I see options for MOV and PNG files, but nothing for JPG/JPEG files.

Is there a way to have the Save To location be whatever was last used? I thought that was the way it worked in the past, but now it doesn't. Any guidance is appreciated. Thanks!
creator: kwadublin

title: Not responding and slow.
content: Help - I have in the last week had many not responding messages and the ever turning wheel. I have removed and reinstalled and now have version 102.8. I have disabled the add on's. I have checked antivirus and cannot see where it has anything to do with TB. I saw an old comment about config - - in config editor you could change the timeout - it defaults to 100. I suggest change to 250 mailnews.tcptimeout - also in config editor, change mail.db.idle_limit set to 30000000 to minimize cpu overhead And did that. After reinstalling it is better but clicking on one email and then onto another it hesitates and there is a loading message at the bottom Any suggestions?

creator: knc1955

title: all incoming emails from 2015 to 2022 disappeared after malware prompt to "compress email folder"
content: A few weeks ago I received a prompt, asking whether I would like to “compact” the data in my email folders (to gain more hard disk space, and to improve performance). At the time I believed that this was a legitimate prompt from the Thunderbird software, but with hindsight I now rather believe that this was caused by a malware attack. At the time I agreed to compact my emails, after which Thunderbird did something for a few minutes, then restarted (as far as I can remember). Thunderbird worked perfectly well after that, and I didn't think about it anymore. Until I was looking for an important email that I received a few months ago. I was shocked to find out that all incoming emails I received between 24.06.2015 and 21.12.2022 were missing from my inbox. I searched in vain for any archive folders or additional Thunderbird profiles. I searched the internet for help, and scanned my hard drives using the tools "Wondershare Data Recovery" and "Recovery Tool for Mozilla Thunderbird". With the latter tool I was able to recover 172 rather unimportant emails (which I had probably deleted myself over the last few years), but the main block of incoming emails (thousands of emails) remains undiscovered. I have not been contacted by anyone for a ransom payment yet. Only the incoming emails have disappeared, not the sent emails. Has anybody else been affected by this malware attack? How can I find out whether the emails are still somewhere on my hard drive and can be still be recovered?
creator: Cld
